tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE production_schedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  start_date DATE,
  end_date DATE,
  progress_percentage INT
)

CREATE TABLE ManufacturingProcesses (
  process_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  process_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  start_date DATE,
  end_date DATE,
  progress_percentage INT
);

CREATE TABLE ProductionSchedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  process_id INT,
  start_time TIME,
  end_time TIME,
  assigned_worker VARCHAR(255),
  FOREIGN KEY (process_id) REFERENCES ManufacturingProcesses(process_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ProductionSchedules (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    production_line INT
);

CREATE TABLE production_schedule (
    schedule_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    start_date DATE NOT NULL,
    end_date DATE NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE manufacturing_processes (
    process_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    process_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    duration_hours INT NOT NULL,
    responsible_person VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE equipment (
    equipment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    equipment_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    maintenance_status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_maintenance_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE production_tasks (
    task_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    deadline DATE,
    assigned_to VARCHAR(100)
);
